answers.answer: My doctor had me start taking baby aspirin yesterday also.  Said he was being conservative since I had a  bit of a pink discharge.

Yes. I'm on the baby aspirin regimen due to the fact that I had pregnancy induced hypertension at 30 weeks with my first that progressed to preeclampsia. However I'm 34 weeks with baby #2 and still no sign of high blood pressure so I think its working.
What? Baby asprin will reduce preeclampsia? I have to bring this up to my OB/Gyn. How are you tsking it? One a day?

That's what I'm seeing when I Google it - seems like baby aspirin is generally considered to have no negative impacts and may have multiple benefits, I guess I'd you have any high risk factors. I don't have any history of miscarriage but did have some trouble getting pregnant (tried for 2 years).I'm nervous about preeclampsia because my SIL almost died after her doctor missed the diagnosis. Nice to see continued research in this area - I just wish I'd known to take it during the fertility treatments since it seems to show some benefits in helping you get pregnant!
Sorry, taking one a day, yes. 81 mg.
mrsJames64 - that's great news! Congrats and be well, all of you. :)

question: Hi ladies - I'm 38 and will be 9 weeks pregnant tomorrow. It took several rounds of IUI fertility treatments (6) to get me here and as soon as I started having symptoms at 4 weeks, fertility doc said to start a baby aspirin regimen. Looking into it, it seems like relatively new research revealing many benefits in women over 35, particularly reduced risk of pre-eclampsia among other things.Just wondering if anyone else is doing this? My friends with babies hadn't heard about it. I'm not high risk for any reason besides "advanced maternal age," as they so delightfully refer to it.
title: Baby aspirin regimen?
